pageContext.description: Rough casting with horizontal raised band below a collar and four vertical ribs ending in pellets on two sides; between each rib there is a dot in the centre of two concentric circles. Hole on one side caused through faulty casting.
pageContext.publications: Ant. Journ. XXVIII, (1948), pp. 157-163 and Plate XX, 2.,Sussex N. & Q. Vol 12, 1, pp. 9-11.
pageContext.site: England,Sussex,Sompting,Hill Barn Nurseries,Discovered by a mechanical excavator at a point 300 feet north-east of Hill Barn, Sompting and 1500 feet south-west of the south-west edge of Lancing Ring (TQ 176062), October 1946. Five feet deep in an accumulation of brown clayey mould.
